servinfo.title: ESP® Warning Light Comes ON Steady

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to ESP® Warning Light Does Not Come ON at Ignition Switch ON .

servinfosub.title: Circuit Description
servinfosub.ptxt: Operation (ON/OFF) of ESP® warning light is controlled by ESP® control module through light driver module in combination meter.

If ESP® system is in good condition, ESP® control module turns ESP® warning light ON at the ignition switch ON, keeps it ON for 2 seconds and then turns it OFF. If an abnormality in the system is detected, ESP® warning light is turned ON continuously by ESP® control module. Also, it is turned ON continuously by light driver module when the connector of ESP® control module is disconnected.

action.ptxt: Go to applicable DTC diag. flow.

testgroup.question: Are main fuses for pump motor and solenoid valves in good condition?

action.ptxt: Replace fuse and check circuit for short to ground.

test1.ptxt: Check for proper connection to ESP® control module connector at terminals “E53-39”, “E53-16” and “E53-47”.
If OK then turn ignition switch to ON position and measure voltage between terminal “E53-35” and vehicle body ground.
Turn ignition switch to OFF position.
Check for proper connection to ESP® control module connector at terminals “E53-1” and “E53-32”.
If OK then turn ignition switch to ON position and measure voltage between each terminal of “E53-1”, “E53-32” and vehicle body ground.
Turn ignition switch to OFF and measure resistance between each terminal of “E53-16”, “E53-47” and vehicle body ground.

action.ptxt: Ground circuit for ESP® control module open or high resistance.

test1.ptxt: Check CAN communication circuit between combination meter and ESP® control module.

testgroup.question: Is CAN communication circuit in good condition?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good combination meter and recheck. If ABS warning light remains ON, substitute a known-good ESP® hydraulic unit / control module assembly and recheck.
